column5: Can anyone tell me why reel companies use line test ratings as an indication of yard of capacity? Has braid (along with many other styles of line) not made this rating system obsolete? Jim
I think most also list line diameter in mm and capacity in M as well.  And I guess that is why the braid manufacturers list a comparable mono line test on their packaging.  Burt
Braid still has a diameter rated in lbs.  For example, 15lb test, 4lb diameter.  S.
For most the best option is to look at line diamiter. Some reels now also list the braid capacity. Not sure how accurate it it though.
Has anyone ever checked to be sure, now that would be anal!
It doesn't make much difference if you only put 100yds of braid on top of mono to start with  S.
shimano has their spool ratings for mono and power pro
And another example,8/30 power Pro would be 8lb diameter,30 lb strength.
yep, shimano bought out innovative textiles, which produces power pro...didn't take long after power pro hit the market
